content:
Hi bevaconme!

To be able someone to help you, please be more specific!

You bought a new laptop last year, you retrieved your old e-mail files only to 2016, where did you retrieve them from???

You said you "have files going back to 1998"! I believe you meant to say "e-mails", not files. So, where you have these e-mails from 1998?

Thunderbird can't do magic! Therefore, how you think it can retrieve these files? Do you have them somewhere to be imported?

Regards, george.

creator: myoo60

content: Doplňky nejsou součástí Thunderbirdu. Můžeš se obrátit na jeho autora. Možná k tomu bude více v uživatelské příručce doplňku.
creator: poljos-moz

content: POP is alive and well and many swear they'll never leave it. Anyway, I wonder if you're using Gmail. My thought on that is that Gmail offers settings that create duplicate views, causing lots of storage to be used. IMAP accounts don't respond to control from email clients well, and most show incoming messages immediately, regardless of the setting for periodic checks. On your question, the data is downloaded depending on your synchronization&storage settings. If you specify all messages locally, then you will experience a degree of downloading as Thunderbird verifies at startup that all messages are, indeed, locally available.
creator: davidsk

content:
Hi David and thanks for posting. I thought POP had disappeared years ago. The accounts are all IMAP. The concern was how much data was being consumed. The iPhone shows that a massive amout of data is being used up by the email accounts. This is why I'm trying to find out if all of the emails are refreshed (Downloaded again) or if it's just the new emails that are added. I know that it's only the header info of the email that is shown until it's clicked on.

The accounts are set to fetch at 15 minute intervals. Agai I know the contents aren't downloaded if it's not selected. Hope this further info will help.
creator: BigDingus

content: More information would help. If the account is POP, most users set the account to download the message to PC and then delete from server, but that's an option. If IMAP, all messages remain on the server. If you tell us more about the accounts, someone here may have suggestions on reducing the space being used.
creator: davidsk

content: Ok, I don't know. When I do it with keyboard, it works. I suggest rechecking your filters. The one that sets it to star should also set to unstar. My suggestion is to run that filter twice, first to verify that it stars a message and then run a second time. My hope is that, since it is confirmed to star, that it will also unstar.

content: The 'add star' feature is a toggle. Do it once and it stars the message; do it again and it unstars.
